etymology.description: Depicts a hand holding a brush or writing implement
etymology.interpretation: The character 聿(聿) (yù, "brush") visually represents a hand grasping a writing tool, which is suggestive of its association with writing or drawing actions.

examples.chinese: 书法家拿起𰀁(書法家拿起𰀁)，挥洒时代风采(揮灑時代風采)。
examples.pinyin: Shūfǎjiā ná qǐ yù, huīsǎ shídài fēngcǎi.
examples.english: The calligrapher picked up the brush and displayed the spirit of the times.

examples.chinese: 他用𰀁蘸上墨汁(他用𰀁蘸上墨汁)，练习工整字迹(練習工整字跡)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng yù zhàn shàng mòzhī, liànxí gōngzhěng zìjì.
examples.english: He dipped the brush into ink and practiced writing with neat strokes.
